DataElement.preferredName: Biologically-Derived Material Product Material Code Sentinel CDM Transfusion Product Code Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Natural substances derived from living organisms such as cells, tissues, proteins, and DNA.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._A system of numbered categories for representation of data._Code type for the value in TransCode. Transfusion product code type. This variable combined with the TransCode variable should be used to capture any type of Inpatient Infusion product in the source data.  Other code types will be added as new terminologies are used.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sentinel CDM Transfusion Product Code Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Code type for the value in TransCode. Transfusion product code type. This variable combined with the TransCode variable should be used to capture any type of Inpatient Infusion product in the source data.  Other code types will be added as new terminologies are used.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A linear barcode symbology developed in 1972 by Pitney Bowes Corp.

Concepts.definition: A linear barcode symbology developed in 1972 by Pitney Bowes Corp.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.

Concepts.definition: A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
